articles.author: David Gauthier-Villars, Nidal Al-Mughrabi, John Davison
articles.description: Israel has failed to crack down on armed gangs attacking food convoys in Gaza, despite a pledge to do so in mid-October to help ward off famine in the Palestinian enclave, according to three U.N. and U.S. officials familiar with the matter.
articles.title: Looting cripples food supply in Gaza as Israel neglects pledge to tackle gangs, sources say

articles.author: Jaidaa Ahmad, Mahmoud Salama, Ahmed Mohamed Hassan
articles.description: Syrian refugees and residents in Egypt face an uncertain future as new regulations may jeopardise their right to remain in the country after Bashar al-Assad's ouster earlier this month.
articles.title: Uncertainty clouds fate of Syrians in Egypt after Assad ouster

articles.author: Ryan Mcneill, Nafisa Eltahir, Lena Masri, Khalid Abdelaziz, Deborah Nelson
articles.description: The famine in Sudan is one of the worst starvation crises in modern times.
articles.title: Global hunger monitor says famine in war-torn Sudan is spreading

articles.author: Tom Balmforth
articles.description: Spying runs in the family for Oleh Kolesnikov.
articles.title: Insight: How one man became a Ukrainian traitor and Russian spy

articles.author: Jaimi Dowdell, Kaylee Kang, Benjamin Lesser, Raymon Troncoso
articles.description: It’s a simple but brutal equation: The number of people going hungry or otherwise struggling around the world is rising, while the amount of money the world’s wealthiest nations are contributing toward helping them is dropping.
articles.title: Global hunger crisis deepens as major nations skimp on aid

articles.author: Lizbeth Diaz
articles.description: Amid a fresh wave of violence, Mexico's President Claudia Sheinbaum has sent her security chief and thousands of troops to stem a bloody escalation of drug cartel crime in Sinaloa state, signaling a shift in security strategy in the Latin American nation.
articles.title: Mexico's president may be toughening fight with drug cartels

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Israeli troops forced the evacuation of the Indonesian Hospital in northern Gaza and many patients, some of them on foot, arrived at another hospital miles away in Gaza City, the territory's health ministry said.
articles.title: Israeli army forces patients out of a north Gaza hospital, medics say

articles.author: Pesha Magid
articles.description: Saudi Arabia executed 330 people this year, the highest number in decades, despite de facto ruler Mohammed bin Salman's 2022 assertion that the death penalty had been eliminated except for murder cases under his vision for a new open kingdom.
articles.title: Saudi executions rose sharply in 2024

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: South Korea's main opposition party plans to "immediately" take steps to impeach acting president Han Duck-soo, the party's floor leader said on Tuesday.
articles.title: South Korean opposition plans to impeach acting president Han, floor leader says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Ukraine said Russia had attacked it with 60 drones overnight, of which 36 were downed, 23 were jammed by electronic warfare and one was still in the air.
articles.title: Ukraine says Russia used 60 drones in overnight attack
